title: Domain 5.5: Given a scenario, use the appropriate tool or protocol to solve networking issues.
content:
🛠️ Software Tools

🔍 Protocol Analyzer (Wireshark)

Definition: Captures and analyzes network traffic at packet level.

Use Case: Troubleshooting communication errors, detecting bottlenecks, analyzing suspicious traffic.

💻 Command Line Tools

ping
Definition: Tests basic connectivity and latency.
Use Case: Confirm host availability, diagnose latency or packet loss.

traceroute/tracert
Definition: Identifies path packets take through the network.
Use Case: Locate points of delay or routing issues.

nslookup
Definition: Queries DNS servers for domain-to-IP mapping.
Use Case: Troubleshoot DNS resolution issues.

tcpdump
Definition: Captures packets via CLI on Linux/macOS.
Use Case: Server-side troubleshooting, examine traffic.

dig
Definition: Advanced DNS querying tool.
Use Case: Check authoritative DNS records.

netstat
Definition: Shows network connections and listening ports.
Use Case: Diagnose open ports, active sessions.

ip/ifconfig/ipconfig
Definition: Displays network configurations.
Use Case: Check IPs, gateways, renew DHCP leases.

arp
Definition: Manages ARP cache.
Use Case: Detect IP/MAC conflicts, spoofing.

🎯 Nmap

Definition: Network scanner identifying hosts, ports, OS types.
Use Case: Mapping networks, testing firewalls, vulnerabilities.

🔗 LLDP/CDP

Definition: Layer 2 discovery protocols.
Use Case: View device neighbors, troubleshoot physical links.

🚀 Speed Tester

Definition: Measures upload/download speeds.
Use Case: Bandwidth testing, ISP performance checks.

🧰 Hardware Tools

🎵 Toner

Definition: Identifies cables by sending audio tones.
Use Case: Locate cables in crowded panels.

✅ Cable Tester

Definition: Verifies wiring, continuity.
Use Case: Find bad terminations, broken wires.

🔌 Taps (Network Taps)

Definition: Passive traffic capture devices.
Use Case: Non-intrusive monitoring for analysis or security.

📡 Wi-Fi Analyzer

Definition: Evaluates wireless performance and interference.
Use Case: Optimize AP placement, fix weak signal areas.

🔦 Visual Fault Locator (VFL)

Definition: Laser tool to find fiber breaks.
Use Case: Spotting physical fiber damage or bends.

💻 Basic Networking Device Commands

📇 show mac-address-table
Displays learned MACs on switches.
Use Case: Track devices by port.

🗺️ show route
Shows routing table.
Use Case: Verify routes, diagnose misrouted packets.

🔌 show interface
Interface stats, errors, speed.
Use Case: Fix interface issues, check duplex mismatches.

📖 show config
Device’s running configuration.
Use Case: Backup or verify settings.

🖥️ show arp
ARP cache on routers/switches.
Use Case: Debug L2/L3 IP-to-MAC issues.

📂 show vlan
Lists VLANs and associated ports.
Use Case: Confirm proper segmentation and tagging.

🔋 show power
Displays PoE power stats.
Use Case: PoE budgeting, detect power issues on endpoints.
